Snipe Server API Documentation

package snipe.cache

class AsyncWorker

Asynchronous worker thread. Used for long SQL queries or some work of that nature that should not slow down the slave server thread.

Note: You should use local query() calls instead of server.query() when doing SQL queries in worker functions so that none of the slave threads will wait for query completion.

Methods

inline call (name:String, serverID:Int, params:Dynamic, workerFunc:Int ‑> Dynamic ‑> Void, responceFunc:Int ‑> Dynamic ‑> Void):Void

Adds a call to worker queue.

Parameters:

name

Call name. "profiler.start", "profiler.stop", or "profiler.reset" are reserved.

serverID

Slave server ID.

params

Parameters given both to worker and responce function.

workerFunc

Worker function. Runs in async worker thread. Called like this: workerFunc(serverID, params).

responceFunc

Responce function. Runs in main worker thread. Called like this: responceFunc(serverID, params).

query (q:String):ResultSet

Runs SQL query through the async worker database connection.

Note: Async worker has a separate database connection specifically so that its queries won't slow down any of the slave server threads.

Parameters:

q

SQL query string.

Returns:

The result of the query.

queryTrace (q:String):ResultSet

Runs SQL query with tracing enabled.

Parameters:

q

SQL query string.

Returns:

The result of the query.
